intro: Vauanthes chloriflora, commonly known as the green-flowered vauanthes, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves that are typically a deep green with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are a hallmark of the genus. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical botanical gardens.
